schema:name: Percentage of sampled fulmars having more than 0.1g of plastic in their stomach, Greater North Sea, 2004-2008 to 2018-2022

schema:creator.schema:name: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

schema:isBasedOn.schema:name: Fulmar Litter Monitoring in the UK: Update 2022

schema:author.schema:name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

schema:variableMeasured: Percentage of sampled fulmars having more than 0.1g of plastic in their stomach
notes:
Data on fulmars are presented as 5-year moving average time periods because annual data may show strong variation as the sample size may fluctuate.  

</br>Avian flu outbreaks in seabird species have led to restrictions on the collection of fulmars on English beaches. This has led to reductions in the number of sampled fulmars in 2022. 

</br>The data has been subject to slight changes since the last annual update to the Outcome Indicator Framework as a small number of Fulmars collected in the Celtic Seas region have been included, however this indicator remains mainly relevant to the Greater North Sea.

columns.name: time_period
columns.schema:description: The time period for the data shown

columns.name: percentage
columns.schema:description: Percentage of sampled fulmars having more than 0.1g of plastic in their stomach
